alert.note: Alert for Hendry; Inland Collier County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 5:34PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Collier and west central Hendry Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 534 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a funnel cloud near Immokalee, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Funnel clouds occasionally touch down and produce tornadoes or waterspouts. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ave Maria, Immokalee, Felda, Big Corkscrew Island, Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Keri, Bunker Hill and Lake Trafford. FUNNEL CLOUD...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Persons participating in outdoor activities should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes. Open shelters found in parks, beaches, or golf courses offer no protection from the dangers of lightning.
